information: Incumbent Republican Senator Lindsey Graham, in office since 2003, has commenced his 2026 re-election campaign. He has secured endorsements from prominent party figures, including former President Donald Trump, Governor Henry McMaster, and Senator Tim Scott. On the Democratic side, Dr. Annie Andrews, a pediatrician who ran for a House seat in 2022, announced on May 29, 2025, that she would be a candidate in the 2026 Senate race.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: Approximately one month, until the deadline of July 1, 2025.
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Ralph Norman has not declared his candidacy for the US Senate, so the question would resolve as 'No'.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Ralph Norman assesses the political landscape, notes the powerful endorsements for incumbent Lindsey Graham from figures like Donald Trump, and decides against launching a difficult and costly primary challenge. The July 1, 2025, deadline passes without an announcement of his candidacy.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Despite Lindsey Graham's endorsements, Ralph Norman believes a significant portion of the Republican primary electorate desires a more conservative challenger. Having prepared behind the scenes, he launches his campaign in June 2025 to capitalize on this sentiment before the deadline.
forecast.rationale:
The status quo, in which Rep. Norman has not declared a Senate candidacy, is the most likely outcome. The barriers to a successful primary challenge against a long-term incumbent like Lindsey Graham are exceptionally high. The research indicates Graham has solidified his position by securing crucial endorsements from former President Trump, Governor McMaster, and Senator Scott. In a Republican primary, Trump's endorsement alone is a formidable obstacle for any challenger. Furthermore, the deadline is just over a month away. Launching a credible statewide campaign requires significant time for fundraising, organization, and messaging, and there is no public evidence that such a campaign is imminent. The Axios article speculating on a run is from September 2023, and the lack of recent, concrete steps from Norman suggests the initial consideration may have waned.

My forecast is not lower than 5% because primary challenges from ideological wings of a party are not impossible, and Norman may still be keeping his options open for a last-minute entry if he perceives a sudden weakness in Graham's position. He may have a campaign structure ready to activate on short notice.

My forecast is not higher than 5% because the combination of a very short timeline and the united front of establishment and MAGA support for Graham makes a challenge a very low-probability event. The path to victory for a challenger appears extremely narrow at this moment.

I would increase my forecast if there were credible leaks about Norman hiring statewide campaign staff, a sudden increase in anti-Graham advertising from a group linked to Norman, or if Graham were to make a significant political gaffe. I would decrease it if Norman were to publicly endorse Graham or explicitly rule out a run.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Ralph Norman declare his candidacy for the US Senate race in South Carolina before July 1, 2025?

Question background:
Axios: [Sen. Lindsey Graham may face right-wing primary challenge in 2026](https://www.axios.com/2023/09/13/lindsey-graham-primary-challenge-ralph-norman)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Will Ralph Norman declares his candidacy for the US Senate race in South Carolina before July 1, 2025. If no such announcement has been made before that date, the question resolves as **No**.




Your research assistant's report says:
Incumbent Republican Senator Lindsey Graham, in office since 2003, has commenced his 2026 re-election campaign. He has secured endorsements from prominent party figures, including former President Donald Trump, Governor Henry McMaster, and Senator Tim Scott. On the Democratic side, Dr. Annie Andrews, a pediatrician who ran for a House seat in 2022, announced on May 29, 2025, that she would be a candidate in the 2026 Senate race.

Today is 2025-05-30.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
